title: Dividing The World
opening: Almyran forces are attacking Fódlan's Locket. With her brother suddenly fallen ill, it is up to Hilda to take over the defense. Cyril volunteers to accompany her.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Hey, Professor. I might have to go back home for a little while.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Is someone in your family sick?

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Oh no, nothing like that.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Is there some kind of emergency?

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Well, that's one way of putting it...

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: The Almyran forces are causing trouble at Fódlan's Locket. Oh, do you know where that is? Well, the mountain range that separates the Alliance from Almyra is called Fódlan's Throat. There's a fortress right on top of the throat, and they call that Fódlan's Locket.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: So, you're going to help defend it?

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Well, yeah, you could say that. I'm sure my brother would be able to handle them on his own. But he said he really wants me to help out. I guess he's a bit tired out from all his hard work. Anyway, our dad's not as sprightly as he used to be. He's not up for a fight. Apparently it would look bad if we left it to the retainers. I really, really don't want to go, but I guess I have to.

intro.speaker: Cyril
intro.line: Heya, Hilda. I...well, I wasn't trying to eavesdrop, but I heard ya talking...

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Hm? Oh, what's up, Cyril?

intro.speaker: Cyril
intro.line: You're gonna fight the Almyrans, yeah?

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Yes. But it's nothing you need to worry about, Cyril.

intro.speaker: Cyril
intro.line: It's not that. I was just wondering if...if maybe I could maybe go along with ya?

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: But--you'd be fighting people from your homeland. Do you really want to do that?

intro.speaker: Cyril
intro.line: None of 'em would remember me anyway... It's just that...I got captured in the battle at the Locket, and that's how I ended up here. So I'm kinda worried that other kids who lose their folks might not be so lucky.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What do you mean?

intro.speaker: Cyril
intro.line: Before Lady Rhea took me in, I had a real hard time as a servant of House Goneril.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: I'm sorry to hear that. But it's not like I'll go around snapping up Almyran children.

intro.speaker: Cyril
intro.line: That's good, but I just... I want to see things for myself, so I know...that everything's OK.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Hm. Well then, let's go together! Oh, would you want to join us, Professor? My brother will be there, but I'm a little scared about fighting all those fierce Almyrans...

intro.speaker: Cyril
intro.line: If you could come too, it would be really great. We'd all feel way safer if you did.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'll come with you.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Great! I know we'll be OK if you're there! Let's head out right away.

intro.speaker: Cyril
intro.line: I'll go and get ready too.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'll think it over.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: You're a real tease, Professor. I know you're going to come along in the end. But we can't wait long, so hurry up on deciding.

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: Most of our allies have fallen. My big brother and I can probably handle this though...

battle.speaker: Goneril Soldier
battle.line: Hilda! Glad you made it! Lord Holst has been afflicted with a sudden illness and couldn't come...

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: He's not here?! Oh... I'm sorry. You must have been absolutely terrified. It's OK though! I brought along someone who can definitely help us! That's you, Professor. Please help us save our allies and protect Fódlan's Locket.

battle.speaker: Cyril
battle.line: Good thing I knew about this back road, huh? We oughta be able to help our friends from here.

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: Oh no! They got one...but we can still rescue the others!

battle.speaker: Goneril Soldier
battle.line: We must defend here, or else... Our house... The Alliance...

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: All our allied troops were wiped out. We won't be able to defend this place.

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: Ah, things are looking up. Let's keep going, and save the others!

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: We did it somehow. Cyril, Professor--thank you.

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: I'm gonna drop by my family's estate and complain to my brother a bit. You two should head back.

end.speaker: Cyril
end.line: They aren't really trying to cross Fódlan's Throat. I'm not saying they're not serious, but fights like this one aren't really invasions.

end.speaker: Cyril
end.line: They just start fights like this sometimes. It's so they can show off how strong they are. I think it's pretty dumb. I mean, people are getting killed! And why? So some guy can think he's tough? After every fight, they do a big feast, and everybody eats and dances and there's music... It's supposed to honor the dead, but I figure they just like to make noise. I think they're all idiots, but if I'm real honest, it wasn't the worst way to live life.

end.speaker: Cyril
end.line: Nah, I'm where I belong now, and I don't really like Almyra. If they wanna show how tough they are, then they oughta look after kids who've lost their parents.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Whew, I'm tired. Professor, Cyril, thanks for all your help.

end.speaker: Cyril
end.line: You get a chance to see your brother?

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: I did. Though I think I'd be better off otherwise. He was horribly ill, for one thing. He looked so pale and haggard. Apparently he'd eaten a bad mushroom before the battle and it made him horribly sick. What an idiot. Anyway, when I told him we'd handled the Almyran situation, he was just gushing with praise. I tried telling him that it wasn't all me, but he didn't even listen.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Weren't you glad to get praise from your brother?

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: That did feel pretty good, I'll admit. But then things got awkward. He started trying to pawn off his whole inheritance. I told him I wanted none of it! Eventually he settled for foisting this thing on me. Do you know what it is?

end.speaker: Cyril
end.line: One heck of an axe. He gave it to ya?

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Yes. It's a magic axe called Freikugel. It's the Hero's Relic of House Goneril. He said that I should have it, since the Crest I bear will allow me to wield it. He was so insistent, I eventually relented. But I don't think I can be responsible for something so precious. Hey, Professor... Why don't you take it instead?

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Heroes' Relics contain terrifying power. They're beyond the capabilities of a novice like me. You're the only person I trust to take care of it. Please, help me out here!

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: If you really think it's necessary...

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Thank you so much! I honestly didn't know what I was going to do with this thing! A big scary axe is not my style. Plus, look closely--parts of the axe are pulsating, like it's alive! How gross is that? But I'll use it if you tell me to, Professor. Or you can get somebody else to wield it, if you like. It's all up to you now!

end.speaker: Cyril
end.line: That Hilda... She really is something.
